derivation.yuyuan_name: Old English distæf: the first element is apparently related to Middle Low German dise, disene 'distaff, bunch of flax'; the second is staff. The extended sense arose because spinning was traditionally done by women

means.word_mean: 1. the sphere of work by women
2. the staff on which wool or flax is wound before spinning
1. characteristic of or peculiar to a woman;

auth_sentence.content: The bundle of flax held on the distaff was the lint-tap or tap o tow.
